wikipedia_page.main:
John Flanagan (26 April 1942 – 30 September 2013) was a Scottish footballer, who played as a forward.
Flanagan played for Albion Rovers, St Johnstone, Partick Thistle and Clyde.

response: John Flanagan or Jack Flanagan may refer to:
* John Flanagan (hammer thrower) (1868–1938), three-time Olympic champion in athletics
* John Flanagan (Limerick hurler) (born 1956), retired Irish hurler
* John Flanagan (Scottish footballer) (1942–2013), played for St. Johnstone, Partick Thistle and Clyde
* John Flanagan (Tipperary hurler) (born 1947), Irish retired hurler
* John Flanagan (author) (born 1944), author of the Ranger's Apprentice series
* John Flanagan (sculptor) (1865–1952), designed the Washington U.S. quarter dollar coin
* Jack Flanagan (Australian politician) (John Flanagan, 1888–1949), Australian politician
* John Flanagan, British actor, in Thriller
